ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race to  12 )
ygData.msgSnippet: If you look at the map link I sent you will see an area directly south of the zone canyon from FV.  There is a line of columns east of the ruins.  The area
ygData.messageBody:
If you look at the map link I sent you will see an area directly south of
the zone canyon from FV. There is a line of columns east of the ruins. The
area between the columns and the hills to the east is heaven for 16-19.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jennifer McComb [mailto:mccomb@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, July 12, 2000 9:07 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race
> to 12 )
>
>
> --- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@p...> wrote:
> > Lake of Ill Omen has mobs ranging from 1st level all the way to the
> low
> > 40's. I would not be surprised if someone could level from 1 to 50
> with
> > out ever leaving this zone. :) And for the mid levels teens to
> high 20's I
> > do not think there is a better zone in the game.
>
>
> Where in Lake of Ill Omen should a high teen fight? When my other,
> now abandoned, bard was level 16, I was having trouble finding any
> good mobs. I kept finding greens and reds, nothing in between.
>
>
> Adagia, Bard of 12 Bellows, Druzzil Ro
